data.title: Nationaltheatret station
data.meta_description: Nationaltheatret station in Oslo opened in 1980 and is located along Drammenbanen line. Train services to all parts of Eastern Norway.
data.text:
Nationaltheatret station in Oslo opened in 1980 and is located along Drammenbanen line. Train services to all parts of Eastern Norway. The station is underground and has three entrances from street level.

Travel information

Travel planning and tickets online

Plan your journey and buy your ticket on the train companies' websites or the national travel planner Entur.

Vy(opens in a new tab)

Flytoget(opens in a new tab)

Entur(opens in a new tab)

Ticket sale

Ticket vending machines.

Airport

Airport express trains depart from the station every 20 minutes.

Bus

Car rental

Taxi

Bus, tram and underground trains.

Bicycle stand

Parking

Car rental offices in Vika car park, 300 metres from the main entrance.

Access to platform (HC)

Elevator (HC)

Other adaptations (HC)

The station is equipped with a mobile ramp for wheelchair users. This is served by the conductor and gives access to trains on demand.

WC (HC)

ATM

Baby changing room

Elevator

Refreshments

Several coffee shops.

Waiting room

Open for all departures.

WC

About the station

Nationaltheatret station opened when the Oslo Tunnel was completed in 1980.

In 1999, the station was expanded to four tracks and a new vestibule with waiting room was put into use.

The station has universal design.

The station has three entrances

From Studenterlunden/Nationaltheatret at Johanne Dybwad's place

From Russeløkkveien

Entrance west from the intersection of Parkveien and Henrik Ibsens gate

Information about the tracks

Westbound trains run from tracks 1 and 2 in the old station hall.

Eastbound trains run from tracks 3 and 4 in the new station hall.

Train directions

The whole of Eastern Norway

Location

Distance from Oslo S: 1.40 km

Municipality: Oslo

Section: Oslo S–Drammen

Line: Drammenbanen

MASL: 22

Find the station
